result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry L Rogers Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Larry L Rogers Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Larry L Rogers Jr was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges with in 1 YEAR of today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court WAVIED DNA sample, previously provided.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence including case 14CF5202, with credit for 88 DAYS time served, straight time.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry L Rogers Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence including case 14CF5202, with credit for 88 DAYS time served, straight time. Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges with in 1 YEAR of today's date, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay. Court WAVIED DNA sample, previously provided.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
AS TO COUNT 2 & 3
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Counts 2 & 3 Dismissed.

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for 8:30 AM. 1st call of the case at 1:30 PM due to scheduling conflict of defense counsel. Discussion regarding Pro Se letter/motion filed by defendant. Defense counsel motioned to adjourn Jury Trial for reasons stated on the record. State objected to adjournment. Court GRANTS adjournment of Jury Trial as a defense adjournment. Court found defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED his right for a speedy jury trial. Court GRANTED state's joinder motion of 14CF5202 & 15CF456 over defense objection. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Parties advised the court there is potential for resolution and further requested a Plea & Sentencing date prior to the Final Pretrial date. State agreed to leave offer open to that date, IF defense counsel contacts state to accept the offer by 5/22/2015 at 5:00 PM. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.
Received & Filed, Letter to the Court.

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel recently appointed. Discussion regarding possible adjournment of Jury Trial date, and defendant's Speedy Trial Demand. For reasons placed on the record, case remains scheduled for Speedy Trial Demand on 5/18/2015 at 8:30 AM in branch 23.
Re-Filed, Scanned & SEALED on order of the court, Letter from defendant (originally received and filed on 3/20/2015, and withdrawn on 3/30/2015).

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea Hearing. Defendant advised the court he no longer wishes to enter a plea in this matter, requests to proceed to trail.   Attorney Saltzwadel informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is unable to be repaired.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Defendant WAIVED his Speedy Trail Demand to date of next court date. Court VACATED Jury Trail date of 4/20/2015 to allow new counsel to be appointed and prepared to proceed. Case set for Motion Hearing/Status of Counsel date and Jury Trial in branch 23. Defendant's motion to withdraw Letter filed with the court, GRANTED. Letter returned to defendnat.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2071 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel in court, defendant Larry L Rogers not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced for Final Pretrial. State's offer has changed. Defense requests adjournment for a Plea & Sentencing date prior to the Jury Trial date of 4/20/2015. Case adjourned for Plea Hearing to branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Speedy trial demand. (SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND WAS ADDRESSED WITH DEPUTY COURT CLERK IN BRANCH 23.)

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Crystal L. Saltzwadel.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Erin Tischer-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding Sheboygan County case #14CF157 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Donna P. or her child.

Defendant Larry L Rogers in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Larry L Rogers in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
